alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Panola; Quitman (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 1:57PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Coahoma, central Quitman and Panola Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 156 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Belen, or 13 miles northeast of Clarksdale, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Marks, Sardis, Lambert, Jonestown, Crenshaw, Sledge, Belen, Darling, Pleasant Grove, Curtis Station, Falcon, Askew, Barksdale, Buxton, Asa, Sabino, Essex, Horatio and Cypress Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
